explanation: The report is correct. The local array p is memset to all-bits-zero at the start of the function (memset(&p, 0, sizeof(p))). Therefore the subsequent statements p[poll_count].revents = 0; simply write a zero into a field that is already zero. Those writes are executed when the corresponding branch is taken but do not change program behaviour if removed (no intervening code modifies revents between the memset and the writes, and p is a local automatic object). Under MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 (“A project shall not contain dead code”), an operation that is executed yet whose removal would not affect program behaviour is dead code. Thus the revents assignments as written are redundant and constitute dead code. Caveat: if there were an unusual platform-specific property (e.g. revents is volatile, or hardware-mapped memory with side effects) then the conclusion could differ; in this code as presented none of those conditions apply. The safe remedies are to remove the redundant assignments or document/justify them as a controlled deviation.
